data.title: Get Current Census Data for Taylor County, FL
data.meta_description: Need Taylor County demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Taylor County, FL from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 21,582 people, Taylor County is the 54th most populated county in the state of Florida out of 67 counties. But watch out, Taylor County, because Holmes County with 19,944 people and Gilchrist County with 19,587 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Taylor County racial/ethnic groups are White (72.1%) followed by Black (20.2%) and Hispanic (4.1%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Taylor County households was $46,239. Taylor County households made slightly more than Jackson County households ($46,144) and Holmes County households ($46,063) . However, 11.2% of Taylor County families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Taylor County residents is 44.3 years young.
